statement:
Write a python program to read from input a string. The input contains COMMA separated string values.
 
The output of the program is the count of string values where 
(a) the length is >= 2;  AND
(b) the first and last character of the string value are the same.

Input:
abc,xyz,aba,1221,1	
Output:
2

Input:
abc, xyz , alpha
Output:
1

[Note that the second string ( xyz ) has SPACE at the start and at the end; while the last string ( alpha) has SPACE only at the start.

simulated_students.question:
Write a python program to read from input a string. The input contains COMMA separated string values.
 
The output of the program is the count of string values where 
(a) the length is >= 2;  AND
(b) the first and last character of the string value are the same.

Input:
abc,xyz,aba,1221,1	
Output:
2

Input:
abc, xyz , alpha
Output:
1

[Note that the second string ( xyz ) has SPACE at the start and at the end; while the last string ( alpha) has SPACE only at the start.

 This is the code I have written so far. 
myinput=input()
vs = myinput.split(',')
simulated_students.ai_response:
```python
myinput = input()
vs = myinput.split(',')
count = 0

for value in vs:
    value = value.strip()  # Remove leading and trailing spaces
    if len(value) >= 2 and value[0] == value[-1]:
        count += 1

print(count)
```
